div.p: iḵtu ēṟu taḻuviyavāṟṟait tōḻi talaivikkuk kāṭṭik kūṟi, avaḷ ēṟu taḻuviya talaivaṉai viruppoṭu nōkkiyavāṟṟait taṉṉuḷḷē kūṟi, muṉṉark kaḷaviṉkaṭ ṭamar kōpittataṉaiyum ayalār poṟātirunta taṉmaiyiṉaiyun talaivikkuk kūṟa, avaḷum avar alar kūṟiyatu naṉṟeṉṟu kūṟi, iṉṟē eṉ neñcu kalantuviṭṭatu iṉi avar koṭuppatākak kūṟiya nāḷiṟ ceyvateṉṉeṉa makiḻntu kūṟa, atu kēṭṭa tōḻi yām 5aṅṅaṉaṅ kūṭi iṉitu irukkumāṟu kākkiṉṟa pāṇṭiyaṉ nīṭu vāḻumāṟu teyvattaip paravukam vāveṉak kūṟiyatu.

lg.l: As those with noisy bustling joy join all together
whom the moving sea yielded along with the pearls that grow on banks,
saying about the lord abounding in hostility from an old clan that has a drum
who gave the way of overcoming [and] killing the king so that he fell
“[this] is the right of the ancient clan of him of a superiority abounding in excellence”,
in order to engage in divine protection saying “let it flourish without evil”
the cowherders, great clan after indestructible clan,
and, together with [their] crowding in [and] choosing with flawless hearts,
the black bull with a clearly shining curl on [his] front,
like the conch put to the mouth of him with the sharp spinning discus,
and the white bull with red stains who is suited to fighting duty,
with much brightness like the bright garland on the chest of his with one earring,
and the brown bull with an eminent hump [and] a dark rough neck,
like the ornament in the sapphire throat of the axe bearer with great name,
and the tawny bull with fierce anger [and] many dots in a group
that resemble the thousand eyes of the one with the awesome thunderbolt,
and the red bull with white legs that shine brightly
so that they resemble the shining white cloth that hangs down as the garment of the strong one with the spear,
while others with strength in [their] legs are numerous
have entered the arena as if
in order to eat lives in a crowd on the occasion of going in formation.
while the instruments sound with the fiercely sounding thundering thunder of the hubbub in the face of the rainy season,
while the vapour of the scattered rain clouds foams, emerging when climbing [and] rising,
while those with perfumed garlands from calyxes with rows after rows of fine petals stand in formation,
the angry herdsmen with an abundance of furious fighting spirit in an excellent raging state
have leapt inside together with the roaring
in order to gain [victory] so that thick covering dust that rises in full reaches the sky.
Gripping the horns, embracing against [his] chest,
settling on the neck, enfolding the hump [all] around,
entering in between the shoulders, fully receiving the impact,
the one who in [his] turn went upon, goring that that [its] long horns have him
the bulls when freed to get to the point of taking don’t stop.
Piercing all those who [try to] take [it] to death on [its] horns,
see the brilliant redness that does not get one who [can] take [it on].
He is similar to Death who will eat lives,
going after [them and] goring [them even] on days short of anger.
The red black bull, piercing those who receive the impact so that they fall,
see [his] bells in a group dance as he raises [his] horns.
He is similar to a bee that surrounds a bud
for [its] nectar, looking for the right moment when it opens full of fitness.
See the white bull that jumps the platform
colliding with the one who took [its] neck, jumping in the middle.
It resembles the milky moon that goes,
seized in the mouth of the snake in the sky that fights the light.
See the cowherd girl who is without motion(?),
looking at the face of the herdsman who took the good bull
with a swaying hump with a thick cover of ancient nature in the high position of victorious fame.
You with fragrant forehead, what? Will our people be in a rage,
not agreeing to ??? for a little jasmine that is fragrant
to smooth [your] five[-fold] tresses, [and] conduct [actions of anger]
like the murderous bull whom he took?
You with long dark tresses, see: this is one word.
About what happened to us with the son of the cowherders with horned herds,
will our people bear it on our account? Those who don’t bear it,
what will be [the point] of rebuking on their part?
What other joy like this is there? My mother
has a knotted stick for beating me. Considering
me with the herder with a flower-adorned chaplet
Being in agreement, the son of the cowherders with the brown herd,
what [is the point] of my people today giving me to him? On that day
my heart entered him at the time he entered
in between the horns of the red black bull who went much upon him.
we will revere the one with the killing discuss
who rest on the serpent bed on the expanse buzzing with song,
saying “Let the one of the mountain with a sweet drum
take the land and shine permanently even beyond
the Himālaya where a waterfall roars that is suited for [his] coming.
